text: Your weekend Insider:
author: RTDSchapiro

text: Three more @GovernorVA vetoes - Republican legislation tightening Elex Day ID requirements, offering slimmed-down alternative to Obamacare and mandating reports to lawmakers on suspected welfare cheats.
author: RTDSchapiro

text: ICYMI: Talking #Va politics this first Friday of spring with @WCVE news director @Craig_Carper https://ideastations.org/radio/news/political-analysis-friday-march-22-2019 … via @wcve

text: Just-out ‘Capitol Chat' podcast: The literal work of lawmaking isn’t done by lawmakers. House clerk Paul Nardo discusses the often-overlooked process for putting a new law on the books
author: RTDSchapiro

text: Good morning! @Craig_Carper and I discuss the latest in #Va politics 8.45a on @wcve News, 88.9 FM. Includes @GovernorVA’s action on 800-plus bills sent him by legislators. He’s issued another veto, this one of a measure with a point: allowing sales of switchblade knives.
author: RTDSchapiro

text: H/T to @_thehalparker for getting into a meeting that was supposed to closed to reporters.
author: RTDSchapiro

text: Today's birthday: It's the 94th for Dr. Ferguson Reid, who in 1967 became first African-American elected to the #Va legislature since Reconstruction, representing Henrico County in the House of Delegates. Best wishes, many happy returns of the day.
author: RTDSchapiro
